localizedText.MSG_UNIQUE_INDEX_CREATE: Create unique index for table {0} failed
localizedText.MSG_DATABASE_OPEN: Opening the database failed with error {0}
localizedText.MSG_HISTORIZE_START: Starting to log symbol {0} every {1} ms with max-entries: {2}
localizedText.MSG_HISTORIZE_FAILED: Historization of symbol {0} ended with Error-Code: {1}
localizedText.MSG_HISTORIZE_FINISHED: Historization of symbol {0} every {1} ms with max-entries: {2} ended
localizedText.descMode: A stricter synchronization mode lowers the chance that the database is corrupted in case of a crash or power failure. The memory journaling mode can also corrupt the database.
localizedText.descInMemory: Active option will save to volatile RAM. Server restart is required.
localizedText.descMaxBackup: Once the maximum number of backups is reached, oldest backups will be deleted.
localizedText.descNumEntries: Including min, max and average values
localizedText.numEntriesLifetime: Entries since the creation of the database
localizedText.descNumEntriesLifetime: Including min, max and average values as well as child data
localizedText.descVacuumOnStartup: Tries to reduce database size. This might take a while on big databases.
localizedText.descCommitInterval: The time between writing each transaction into the database.
localizedText.descStringTypeArray: The times can be specified as time interval, point in time or 'First or Latest'.
localizedText.descStringTypeArrayTimespan: Width of the XAxis in milliseconds.
localizedText.descAxisData: Array with sub-array for each symbol.
localizedText.descTrendLineAxisY: Start and end time for TrendLineChart.
localizedText.descGetTrendLineData: Get an array containing recording time and its data point for each historized symbol.
localizedText.descDeleteDatabaseEntries: Delete records from the historize database. If necessary enable vacuum on config page.
localizedText.descGetTrendLineWindow: Get window for a specific TrendLineChart.
localizedText.descDiagnostics: Get information about the historized data that is stored in the database.
